item.title: 'The Liberation of Sita' By Volga - Book Notes
item.description: â€‹ Thoughts Does Ramayana qualify for a feminist fiction? Post Ram and Sita’s homecoming, Sita was asked to give a chastity test, and she left the palace after proving herself. She could have left without undergoing the test but then the public would have indeed believed that she was at fault. Whether Ramayana is based on true events or if it’s a fictional tale it doesn’t matter, in either case Sita’s character is liberating.
